title: gazebo_ros CI builds failing on r2d2

content.raw:
I noticed that some gazebo_ros CI builds were failing even though they passed on my local machine. I tracked this down to my use of ros-shadow-fixed locally, so I submitted pull request #570. That pull request hasn't been merged, but there has been a sync of packages to the public repo, so it should be working now.

The builds on optimus are working:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ros_gazebo8_pkgs-ci-pr_any_kinetic-xenial-amd64&build=100)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo8_pkgs-ci-pr_any_kinetic-xenial-amd64/100/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo8_pkgs-ci-pr_any_kinetic-xenial-amd64/100/

but the builds on r2d2 are failing to find the correct opencv package:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ros_gazebo8_pkgs-ci-pr_any_kinetic-xenial-amd64&build=101)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo8_pkgs-ci-pr_any_kinetic-xenial-amd64/101/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo8_pkgs-ci-pr_any_kinetic-xenial-amd64/101/

~~~
CMake Error at /opt/ros/kinetic/share/cv_bridge/cmake/cv_bridgeConfig.cmake:113 (message):
  Project 'cv_bridge' specifies '/opt/ros/kinetic/include/opencv-3.3.1-dev'
  as an include dir, which is not found.
~~~

Maybe there's a problem with squid or the docker cache on r2d2?
content.html:
I noticed that some gazebo_ros CI builds were failing even though they passed on my local machine. I tracked this down to my use of ros-shadow-fixed locally, so I submitted pull request #570. That pull request hasn't been merged, but there has been a sync of packages to the public repo, so it should be working now.

The builds on optimus are working:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo8_pkgs-ci-pr_any_kinetic-xenial-amd64/100/

but the builds on r2d2 are failing to find the correct opencv package:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros_gazebo8_pkgs-ci-pr_any_kinetic-xenial-amd64/101/
CMake Error at /opt/ros/kinetic/share/cv_bridge/cmake/cv_bridgeConfig.cmake:113 (message):
  Project 'cv_bridge' specifies '/opt/ros/kinetic/include/opencv-3.3.1-dev'
  as an include dir, which is not found.

Maybe there's a problem with squid or the docker cache on r2d2?
